tldr.heading: Quick Summary (TL;DR)
tldr.point1: MirrorBuddy uses artificial intelligence to personalize teaching and support inclusive learning
tldr.point2: All significant AI decisions are subject to human oversight per the EU AI Act

aiSystem.section1Title: 1. AI System Disclosure (Article 50 - EU AI Act 2024/1689)
aiSystem.section1Para1: In compliance with Article 50 of the EU AI Act (Regulation 2024/1689), MirrorBuddy discloses that the 26 educational maestri available on the platform use generative artificial intelligence. These AI systems are designed to personalize teaching and support students with learning differences.
aiSystem.section1Para2Intro: MirrorBuddy's AI systems include three main categories:
aiSystem.section1Para2Item1: Educational Personalization Systems - Azure OpenAI GPT to adapt content to student learning level and style
aiSystem.section1Para2Item2: Progress Analysis Systems - Spaced repetition (FSRS) algorithms to track knowledge retention
aiSystem.section1Para2Item3: Emotional Support Systems - Text generation models to provide personalized encouragement and constructive feedback
aiSystem.section1Para2Conclusion: All these systems are described in detail in the following sections with information on their functionality, risks, and protections.
aiSystem.section2Para1: The EU AI Act classifies AI systems by risk level. MirrorBuddy has conducted a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) and AI Risk Assessment to determine required compliance level.
aiSystem.section2List1Text: Educational personalization systems (maestro recommendations, difficulty adjustments) are classified as limited risk. We use transparent warnings and enable parent monitoring of AI decisions.
aiSystem.section2List2Text: If MirrorBuddy integrates automated assessment features that could significantly impact educational pathway (Art. 6 AI Act), high-risk controls including mandatory human oversight will be implemented.
aiSystem.section2List3Text: MirrorBuddy complies with Italian Law 132/2025 (EU AI Act implementation). Compliance records are publicly available and subject to regular audit by data protection authorities.
aiSystem.section3Para1: The following AI systems are used in MirrorBuddy to support inclusive teaching:
aiSystem.section3Cat1Items: Uses Azure OpenAI to analyze student comprehension level and adapt maestro explanations. Produces tailored text output and personalized feedback.
aiSystem.section3Cat2Items: Spaced repetition algorithm that determines when to review flashcards for optimal memory retention. Input: historical performance; Output: personalized review schedule.
aiSystem.section3Cat3Items: AI model that creates motivational messages when students face difficulty. Always context-personalized but generic in logic.
aiSystem.section3Cat4Items: Monitoring system that identifies difficulty patterns and triggers educator alerts. NOT used to automatically categorize students without human review.
aiSystem.section3Cat5Items: Uses vector embeddings for intelligent search across student documents. Supports smart search without storing document content in AI vectors.
aiSystem.section3Para2: All systems are designed with integrated human oversight and can be disabled in privacy settings.
aiSystem.section4Title: 4. Human Oversight & Human Control (Article 14 - EU AI Act)
aiSystem.section4Heading: Per Article 14 of the EU AI Act, educational AI systems require meaningful human supervision. MirrorBuddy implements:
aiSystem.section4Item1Text: Parents have access to a Parent Dashboard showing all AI decisions about their child, including maestro recommendations and suggested learning paths.
aiSystem.section4Item2Text: Teachers can view and manually modify AI decisions. No AI decision is final without human approval.
aiSystem.section4Item3Text: If significant difficulty is identified, an educator must intervene within 7 days with personalized support. AI provides suggestions only, not decisions.
aiSystem.section4Item4Text: Quarterly audits verify AI recommendations don't discriminate based on gender, ethnicity, disability, or socioeconomic status.
aiSystem.section4Item5Text: Students and parents can fully disable AI personalization at any time. All core educational features remain available with generic settings.

faqSupport.faq1Answer: When AI recommends a maestro, the Parent Dashboard shows the reasoning (e.g. 'Recommended based on maths performance and interest in art'). You can click for a more detailed explanation. For a full explanation, contact roberdan@fightthestroke.org.
faqSupport.faq1Question: How can I find out why the AI recommended a particular maestro?
faqSupport.faq2Answer: No. AI does not use disability as a direct recommendation factor. MirrorBuddy was designed for universal inclusive teaching. We only use the student's learning profile (learning speed, preferred learning styles).
faqSupport.faq2Question: Does my disability affect AI recommendations?
faqSupport.faq3Answer: Yes. You can completely disable AI personalization in Privacy settings. All personalization data will be deleted, but your account and educational content will remain intact.
faqSupport.faq3Question: Can I delete my AI data without deleting my account?
faqSupport.faq4Answer: MirrorBuddy uses Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o mini for Trial, GPT-5.2-edu for Base, GPT-5.2-chat for Pro) for personalization. We also use proprietary FSRS algorithms for memory tracking. None of these models are trained on MirrorBuddy student data.
faqSupport.faq4Question: Which AI models are you using?
faqSupport.faq5Answer: If we detect discrimination (bias), the system is disabled immediately. The data used for retraining undergoes human audit. Students and parents are notified of the change. If the discrimination caused verifiable educational harm, we offer priority corrective support.
faqSupport.faq5Question: What happens if you discover the AI is discriminating against students?
faqSupport.section10Title: 10. Frequently Asked Questions about AI Transparency
faqSupport.section11Para1: This AI transparency document has been prepared in compliance with Article 50 of the EU AI Act (Regulation 2024/1689) and Italian Law 132/2025. It is publicly available in Italian, English, French, German and Spanish.
faqSupport.section9AuthorityText: If you are not satisfied with our response, you can file a complaint with the Data Protection Authority (garante@gpdp.it)
faqSupport.section9FormText: Use the contact form at www.mirrorbuddy.com/contact to send us feedback on AI transparency. We respond to all requests within 5 business days.
faqSupport.section9Para1: Have questions about our use of AI? You can contact us in the following ways:
faqSupport.section9Para2: We are continuously improving AI transparency. Your feedback helps us build a more responsible and inclusive educational platform.

rightsCompliance.section5Item1Text: You can request to know how the AI made a decision concerning you, including the logic used and the factors considered. Contact roberdan@fightthestroke.org to exercise this right.
rightsCompliance.section5Item2Text: You can export all data used by our AI decisions (conversations, progress, preferences) in a readable format (JSON, CSV). This allows you to transfer your account to another educational platform.
rightsCompliance.section5Item3Text: You can object to data processing for AI personalization and educational profiling. When exercised, MirrorBuddy will immediately disable all AI systems for your account.
rightsCompliance.section5Item4Text: If you believe the data used by the AI is inaccurate (e.g. the assigned difficulty level), you can request that it be corrected. This will reset the student's AI profiles with accurate data.
rightsCompliance.section5Item5Text: You can request that all your AI data be deleted. This will include the personalization history, while keeping core educational features functional.
rightsCompliance.section5Item6Text: If you believe an AI decision has illegally discriminated against you, you can file a complaint with the Data Protection Authority (www.garanteprivacy.it) within 30 days.
rightsCompliance.section5Para1: The EU AI Act and GDPR grant you specific rights regarding AI systems. Here is what you can do:
rightsCompliance.section6Item1Text: Data used to personalize the AI (chat history, progress, preferences) is encrypted end-to-end during transmission to Azure OpenAI.
rightsCompliance.section6Item2Text: MirrorBuddy's generative AI models are never trained on students' personal data. We only use real-time input to adapt responses.
rightsCompliance.section6Item3Text: AI does not create profiles that categorize students by cognitive abilities, disabilities, ethnicity or socioeconomic status in ways that could affect educational opportunities.
rightsCompliance.section6Item4Text: Only our Italian team of security engineers and data protection officer can view data used by AI for audit purposes. Access is logged and subject to review.
rightsCompliance.section6Item5Text: AI personalization data is retained only during the student's active session. Historical data is aggregated and pseudonymized within 90 days.
rightsCompliance.section6Para1: We implement specific security measures to protect how AI uses your data:
rightsCompliance.section6Title: 6. Data Protection and Security in AI Decision-Making
rightsCompliance.section7Para1: MirrorBuddy has identified the following potential AI risks and implemented mitigation measures in compliance with Article 29 of the EU AI Act:
rightsCompliance.section7Risk1Mitigation: Bimonthly fairness audits using diverse datasets. Testing on students of various genders, ethnicities and disabilities to verify unbiased recommendations. Any discrimination detected leads to immediate model retraining.
rightsCompliance.section7Risk2Mitigation: MirrorBuddy encourages human interaction and manual control. The maestri are still the primary interface. AI provides only non-binding suggestions.
rightsCompliance.section7Risk3Mitigation: End-to-end encryption, data segregation, role-based access policies, permanent audit logs, no extra-EU data transfers without explicit consent.
rightsCompliance.section7Risk4Mitigation: Safety filters built into Azure OpenAI, human review of generated content before delivery, feedback loops for reporting issues, instant disabling if detected.
rightsCompliance.section7Risk5: Lack of Transparency in AI Decisions
rightsCompliance.section7Risk5Mitigation: This document provides full disclosure. Parent Dashboard shows AI reasoning. Support chatbot explains decisions in plain language. Right to explanation guaranteed on request.
rightsCompliance.section7Title: 7. AI Risk Analysis and Mitigation Measures
rightsCompliance.section8Item1Text: A comprehensive DPIA has been conducted and filed with the Data Protection Authority. It is available on request for regulatory audit purposes.
rightsCompliance.section8Item2Text: A comprehensive AI risk analysis has been completed for all systems. No system has been classified as very high risk. Systems classified as high risk include mandatory human oversight.
rightsCompliance.section8Item3Text: We maintain comprehensive compliance records including fairness audits, security tests, transparency reviews and responses to bias reports. These are available for inspection by competent authorities.
rightsCompliance.section8Item4Text: A lawyer specializing in AI verifies quarterly compliance with evolving AI legislation. Any regulatory changes are incorporated within 30 days.
rightsCompliance.section8Para1: MirrorBuddy complies with all requirements of the EU AI Act 2024/1689 and Italian Law 132/2025:
rightsCompliance.section8Para2: The Data Protection Authority has the right to inspect MirrorBuddy at any time to verify compliance. We are fully transparent in our AI practices.

page.title: Data Subject Rights Under GDPR
page.subtitle: Understand your privacy rights and how to exercise them
page.description: MirrorBuddy fully respects your rights as a data subject under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). This page explains each right and how you can request it.

introduction.title: Your Privacy Rights
introduction.content: As a data subject, you have important rights regarding your personal data. GDPR ensures you have full control over your data and the right to know how it's used.
introduction.contactText: Questions about your rights? Contact us at:

access.title: Right of Access (Art. 15 GDPR)
access.description: You have the right to access your personal data at any time.
access.details: You can request a copy of all personal data we hold about you in a readable format. We will provide information about how your data is used, with whom it is shared, and how long we retain it.
access.howToRequest: To exercise this right, contact our support team with a written data access request.

rectification.title: Right of Rectification (Art. 16 GDPR)
rectification.description: You have the right to correct your data if it's inaccurate or incomplete.
rectification.details: If you discover that your personal data is inaccurate, incomplete, or outdated, you can request immediate correction. This includes updating your profile information, educational preferences, or contact details.
rectification.howToRequest: Log into your account and modify your data directly, or contact us for assistance.

erasure.title: Right to be Forgotten - Erasure (Art. 17 GDPR)
erasure.description: You have the right to obtain deletion of your personal data.
erasure.details: Under certain circumstances, you can request complete removal of your personal data from our systems. This includes your account, chat history, learning data, and all associated information.
erasure.limitations: Limitations: Some data must be retained for legal or contractual purposes (e.g., billing). When you delete your account, your data is removed within 30 days unless required by law.
erasure.howToRequest: Contact our privacy support team with a written deletion request.

portability.title: Right to Data Portability (Art. 20 GDPR)
portability.description: You have the right to receive your data in a structured format and transfer it to other services.
portability.details: You can request a copy of your personal data in a machine-readable format (such as JSON or CSV), allowing you to transfer it to another service without information loss. This includes your profile, learning history, progress, and preferences.
portability.howToRequest: Contact our team with a data portability request.

object.title: Right to Object (Art. 21 GDPR)
object.description: You have the right to object to the processing of your data.
object.details: You can object to your data being processed for marketing, profiling, or other purposes. If you exercise this right, we will stop processing your data for the specified purpose, except where we have legitimate reasons to continue.
object.howToRequest: Contact our support team to specify which uses you wish to object to.

restriction.title: Right to Restrict Processing (Art. 18 GDPR)
restriction.description: You have the right to restrict processing of your data.
restriction.details: In some circumstances, you can request that your data be 'frozen' and used only in a limited way. This is useful if you dispute the accuracy of your data or disagree with its processing.
restriction.howToRequest: Contact our privacy team to request processing restriction.

italy.escalationTime: If unsatisfied with our response, you can file a complaint with the supervisory authority within 12 months.

france.escalationTime: You can file a complaint with CNIL if you believe your rights are not respected.

germany.name: Germany
germany.escalationTime: You can file a complaint with BfDI if you have data protection concerns.

spain.name: Spain
spain.authority: AEPD (Agencia Española de Protección de Datos)
spain.escalationTime: You can file a complaint with AEPD for data protection issues.

uk.name: United Kingdom
uk.escalationTime: You can file a complaint with the ICO if your UK data protection rights are violated.

howToExercise.title: How to Exercise Your Rights

steps.step1: Send a written request to roberdan@fightthestroke.org specifying which right you wish to exercise.
steps.step2: Provide as much detail as possible about which data or aspects you want to address.
steps.step3: We verify your identity to protect your data.
steps.step4: We process your request within 30 days and contact you with a response.

howToExercise.contactInfo: If you have questions during the process, our team is available to assist you.

faq.q1: How long does it take to respond?
faq.a1: We are required to respond within 30 days of receiving your request. If your request is complex, we may extend this by an additional 60 days.
faq.q2: Do I have to pay to exercise my rights?
faq.a2: No, you don't have to pay. However, if we believe your request is manifestly unfounded or excessive, we may charge a reasonable fee.
faq.q3: What if you don't grant my request?
faq.a3: If we refuse your request, we will explain why and provide information on how to contest the decision.
faq.q4: Can I complain after receiving a response?
faq.a4: Yes, if you're unsatisfied with our response, you can file a complaint with your country's data protection authority.

section1.title: Who We Are and How This Policy Works
section1.content: MirrorBuddy is an educational app for students with learning differences, developed by an international team with UK representation. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal data. As your data controller, we are responsible for protecting your personal information in compliance with the UK General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018.

section2.title: What Data We Collect
section2.intro: To provide our service, we collect these personal data:

items.name: Used to personalise your experience
items.conversations: Saved to continue learning from where you left off
items.flashcards: Used to track your learning via FSRS algorithm
items.progress: Recorded to give you personalised feedback
items.settings: Saved to remember your accessibility and language choices

section3.title: Sensitive Data We Never Collect
section3.intro: To protect your privacy, we never collect sensitive data such as:

items.health: Health information (unless you voluntarily share it in a conversation)
items.payments: Direct payment details (we use certified third parties)

section4.title: How We Use Your Data
section4.intro: We use your data only for these legitimate purposes:

itemLabels.support: Help you if you have problems

items.appFunctionality: Load your conversations, flashcards and progress
items.personalization: Adapt the maestri to your interests and learning level
items.improvement: Understand how you use MirrorBuddy to add new features (with optional analytics)
items.support: Help you if you experience technical or pedagogical issues

section4.disclaimer: We do not use your data for automated profiling, targeted advertising, or decisions about you without human involvement.

section5.title: Optional Analytics and Tracking
section5.intro: As a user, you can choose to participate in our analytics to help us improve the app.
section5.weCollect: Pages visited, time spent, features used, errors encountered. No personal data is stored in logs.
section5.why: To understand which features are helpful, where students struggle, and how to make MirrorBuddy better for everyone.
section5.retention: Analytics data is retained for 12 months, then aggregated and removed.
section5.optOut: You can disable analytics in privacy settings without losing any functionality.

section6.title: Who Can Access Your Data
section6.intro: Your personal data is accessible to:

items.you: You have complete control of your data and can download, modify or delete it
items.parents: Your parents can monitor your progress via the Parent Dashboard (if you are a minor)
items.team: The MirrorBuddy team accesses data for technical support, only when necessary

section6.thirdPartyIntro: We use these certified services to run MirrorBuddy safely:

vendors.azure: Azure OpenAI (conversational data processing, GDPR compliant)
vendors.brave: Brave (optional privacy-first search, doesn't collect IP)
vendors.google: Google Drive (optional for document uploads, only when you choose to connect)
vendors.grafana: Grafana (system metrics only, no personal data)
vendors.ollama: Ollama (optional local AI models, all on-device)

section6.noOtherAccess: No other service has access to your data. We do not sell data to third parties.
section6.extraEUNote: Note: Azure OpenAI processes some conversational data in the USA with Standard Contractual Clauses (SCC) as per UK GDPR Art. 46.

section7.title: Legal Basis for Processing
section7.primary: We process your personal data on these legal bases under UK GDPR: (1) Contractual necessity (Art. 6.1.b) - to provide the service; (2) Explicit consent (Art. 6.1.a) - for optional analytics and communications; (3) Legitimate interest (Art. 6.1.f) - for security, fraud prevention, service improvement.
section7.transfers: Data transfers to non-UK countries (such as the USA) only occur for services with approved Standard Contractual Clauses (SCC) or UK adequacy decisions.
section7.legalBasis: Your legal basis for data processing is consent to the service (contract) and, where applicable, explicit consent you have given in settings.

section8.title: Data Controller and Processors
section8.intro: MirrorBuddy is the data controller. However, some services are processed by data processors who process data on our behalf under DPA (Data Processing Agreements) compliant with UK GDPR Art. 28.

subprocessors.vercel: Hosting and global CDN - EU-based, SOC 2 Type II certified
subprocessors.supabase: Managed PostgreSQL database - EU-based, ISO 27001 certified
subprocessors.resend: Transactional email service - EU-based, with UK GDPR compliant DPA
subprocessors.azure: Conversational AI processing - USA-based but with SCC and OneTrust compliant

section8.gdprObligations: All data processors have signed DPA contracts compliant with UK GDPR Art. 28 and 32. You can request a copy of our DPAs by writing to info@fightthestroke.org.

section9.title: How Long We Keep Your Data

items.activeAccount: While your account is active, we retain all your data (email, conversations, flashcards, progress) to provide the service
items.conversations: Conversations with maestri are retained for 90 days of inactivity, then archived for 1 year, then deleted
items.webVitals: Technical data (Web Vitals, errors) is retained for 12 months for improvement, then aggregated and deleted
items.deletedAccount: When you delete your account, all data is deleted within 30 days (backup: 90 days by law). Aggregated research data remains pseudonymised

section10.title: Your Privacy Rights
section10.intro: You have the right to exercise your privacy rights at any time. These rights include access, rectification, erasure, portability, objection, and restriction of processing.

items.access: You can request a copy of all your personal data in a readable format
items.correct: You can request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data
items.delete: You can request complete deletion of your personal data
items.export: You can receive your data in a structured format (JSON, CSV)
items.oppose: You can object to processing your data for certain purposes

section16.title: 16. Artificial Intelligence Systems and User Rights
section16.aiSystems: MirrorBuddy uses artificial intelligence systems to personalize your educational experience. All our AI systems are transparent, controllable, and designed with integrated human oversight. We do not make automated decisions that significantly impact your education without human review.
section16.aiDataHeading: Which Data We Process with AI
section16.aiDataIntro: The following personal data is processed by our AI systems:

aiDataItems.messages: Your conversations with teachers are analyzed to personalize the tone and difficulty level
aiDataItems.context: Your grade level, subjects of interest, and learning style are used to adapt content
aiDataItems.profile: Your progress data (flashcards, quizzes, exercises) is used to recommend the next topic to learn

section16.notProcessed: Your sensitive information (health data, location, biometric information) is never processed with AI, even if shared voluntarily.
section16.aiDecisionsHeading: How We Make Decisions with AI
section16.aiDecisions: AI-based decisions affect your learning experience in these ways:

aiDecisionsItems.access: Teacher Access: AI recommends which teachers might be most helpful to you based on your interests
aiDecisionsItems.benefits: Educational Benefits: AI identifies your strengths and areas where you might need extra support
aiDecisionsItems.education: Learning Path: AI suggests which topic to learn next to optimize memory retention

section16.aiDecisionsNote: Note: None of these decisions are final without human intervention. Parents and teachers can always override AI suggestions.
section16.aiRightsIntro: According to the EU AI Act, you have the following rights regarding automated decisions:

aiRightsItems.humanReview: You can request that a person (teacher or parent) review any AI-based decision
aiRightsItems.feedback: You can share feedback on how AI has impacted your learning, and we will use this feedback to improve
aiRightsItems.transparency: You can request an explanation of how and why AI made a particular decision about your learning
aiRightsItems.oppose: You can object to the processing of your data with AI systems at any time

section16.transparencyIntro: We implement these measures to remain transparent about our AI systems:

transparencyItems.review: We review our AI systems quarterly to ensure they work correctly and fairly for all students
transparencyItems.monitoring: We continuously monitor AI outcomes to detect and correct any bias or errors
transparencyItems.reporting: We publish quarterly reports on our Model Card that describe how our AI systems work
transparencyItems.retention: We retain logs of AI decisions for 90 days for review and improvement, then delete them

section16.learnMoreText: for complete information about our AI architecture, bias testing, and how we use conversational data.

tierSystem.title: Service Tiers and Data Collection
tierSystem.intro: MirrorBuddy offers three service tiers with different levels of access and data collection. Understanding which tier you are using helps you understand what personal data we collect and how we use it.

trial.title: Trial Tier (Anonymous Access)
trial.description: Trial users can access MirrorBuddy without creating an account. This tier provides limited access with minimal data collection. You can use up to 10 chat messages per month and 5 minutes of voice interaction. Only 3 maestri (AI teachers) are available. We collect only a visitor-id cookie (anonymous, 30-day expiry) to track usage limits. No email, name, or personal profile data is collected. No login required. No payment information collected.

base.title: Base Tier (Free Registered Account)
base.description: Base tier users must create a free registered account with email and name. This tier provides full access to core educational features with unlimited chat messages and unlimited voice interaction time. Access to 25 maestri (AI teachers). We collect and store: email address (for login and notifications), name (for personalized greetings), conversation history (to continue learning sessions), flashcard data and learning progress (for spaced repetition algorithm), user preferences and accessibility settings. No payment information collected for this tier.

pro.title: Pro Tier (Paid Subscription)
pro.description: Pro tier users have a paid subscription at €9.99/month processed via Stripe. This tier provides premium access with all features: unlimited chat messages, unlimited voice interaction, access to all 26 maestri (AI teachers) including exclusive premium teachers, priority support and advanced features. We collect all Base tier data plus: payment information processed by Stripe (not stored directly by MirrorBuddy), billing address and invoice history (for accounting and tax compliance), subscription status and renewal dates. Payment data is handled by Stripe under their own Data Processing Agreement (DPA) compliant with GDPR.

tierSystem.dataNote: Your subscription tier determines what personal data we collect. You can view and control your data at any time in your privacy settings. Upgrading or downgrading your tier changes your data collection profile accordingly. When you downgrade from Pro to Base or delete your account, payment data retention follows our standard retention policy (billing records retained for 7 years for tax compliance, then permanently deleted).

azureRealtimeVoice.dataProcessed: Voice audio data streamed in real-time for text-to-speech and speech-to-text conversion. Audio is processed ephemerally without persistent storage.
azureRealtimeVoice.legalBasis: Contractual necessity (Art. 6.1.b GDPR) - processing necessary to provide voice interaction features within educational service
azureRealtimeVoice.dpaStatus: Microsoft Data Processing Agreement (DPA) with Standard Contractual Clauses (SCC) for extra-EU transfers

section1.content1: MirrorBuddy is an AI-powered educational platform designed to support students with learning differences (SLD). The platform offers 26 virtual maestri (educational characters with unique personalities and knowledge), flashcards with spaced repetition algorithm (FSRS), adaptive quizzes, mind maps and gamification tools.
section1.content2: MirrorBuddy is developed by the Fightthestroke Foundation with the goal of making learning inclusive and accessible to all. The platform complies with European data protection regulations (GDPR), artificial intelligence regulations (EU AI Act 2024/1689) and accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA).
